newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH SKODA AUTO TO GET 80,000 TONNES OF VSZ STEEL.
newsitem.headline: CZECH SKODA AUTO TO GET 80,000 TONNES OF VSZ STEEL.

text.p: Volkswagen AG's Czech unit, Skoda Auto a.s., said on Friday it had chosen Slovak steel maker VSZ a.s. to supply most of the cold-rolled steel sheets for its economy model, the Felicia, next year.
"VSZ will deliver to us 80,000 tonnes of steel sheets next year, almost all cold-rolled, which are used for most of the Felicia production," Milan Smutny, Skoda spokesman, told Reuters.
However, Smutny added that the Czech car maker would look West for specially-produced steel sheets for its new Octavia mid-sized sedan.
"Skoda will cover the need for electrolytic zinc-coated steel sheets for (its new mid-sized sedan) Octavia production exclusively from Western Europe," he added.

Two months ago, VSZ said it had been considering investing into a new electrolytic zinc-coating production line for steel sheets because it had already had an offer from Skoda to purchase the new line production.
But Smutny declined to comment on the issue.
